Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for thursday, november 13th. meta platforms is moving forward with its plans to lay off another round of employees as part of its broader restructuring plan. ceo mark zuckerberg announced that these layoffs are part of an effort to cut excess roles and streamline the organization, aiming to make meta more efficient and focused on its metaverse strategy. the company has already seen a dip in its stock price following the initial announcement, reflecting investor uncertainties.

meanwhile, google is facing scrutiny as it gears up to launch its new ai-powered search capabilities. this comes amid rising pressure from competitors who are significantly boosting their own ai frameworks. google executives remain optimistic about maintaining their lead, emphasizing their investment in ai research and development. analysts suggest the upcoming product launch will be a critical moment for google's market position.

on the hardware front, samsung's latest foldable phone has been making waves in tech circles. with an improved hinge design and upgraded camera system, early reviews are touting it as the best foldable on the market yet. samsung's innovative approach to mobile technology continues to drive interest and sales despite increasing competition in the segment.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for thursday, november 13th.

meta platforms is pushing ahead with another round of layoffs as part of its widespread restructuring effort. ceo mark zuckerberg says the move aims to cut down on excess roles and streamline the organization, with a sharp focus on the company's metaverse strategy. this announcement has already caused a dip in meta's stock price, highlighting investor concerns over the company's direction.

in other news, google is under scrutiny as it prepares to launch new ai-driven search capabilities. with rising competitive pressure, google executives remain confident about staying ahead, citing strong investments in ai research and development. analysts believe this launch will be a pivotal moment in google's market positioning.

now, onto the hardware scene. samsung's latest foldable phone is making headlines in tech circles. boasting an improved hinge design and upgraded camera system, early reviews are hailing it as the best foldable on the market. samsung's knack for innovation continues to spark interest and drive sales, even amidst growing competition in the mobile segment.

that's all for today's briefing. see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-409 Meta's Layoff Wave 💼, Google’s Ai Search Leap 🔍, Samsung’s Foldable Revolution 📱
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for thursday, november 13th! here's a glance at today's tech insights:

  • meta platforms' restructuring: ceo mark zuckerberg announces another round of layoffs to streamline operations, focusing on the metaverse strategy. investor concerns grow as stock prices dip.
  • google's new ai-driven search: as google gears up to launch its latest ai search features, executives cite strong investments in ai r&d. this pivotal launch aims to secure google's market position amidst rising competition.
  • samsung's foldable phone innovation: samsung's new foldable phone impresses with an improved hinge design and upgraded camera, earning early praise as the best foldable on the market.

stay tuned for tomorrow's tech updates!
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image depicting a dynamic and futuristic cityscape at dusk, embodying the intersection of technology and innovation. in the foreground, a sleek, translucent skyscraper symbolizes meta's transformation, its glass facade reflecting silhouettes of workers in motion. interspersed among the buildings, ai-infused search lights beam upwards from various rooftops, casting a spectral glow into the sky and representing google's ai search leap. to the side, a massive, unfolded samsung device hovers above the city, its screen displaying vibrant and interactive digital content that flows seamlessly into the city's architecture. the background features a deep, twilight sky, where abstract constellations form shapes reminiscent of tech circuit patterns, underscoring the theme of a connected digital revolution. the elements blend together to create a unified image of a world on the brink of technological evolution, brimming with potential and innovation
